sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Brief memorial of the losse of the late incomparable and excellent Andrew Lord Rutherford Earle of Teveot, &c. Killed by an ambuscadoe of Moores, May the 3d. 1664. Rich, Jeremiah, fl. 1664.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (metalcut).
Printed for Henry Marsh at the Princes Armes in Chancery-Lane, London, : 1664.
Signed at end: Jeremiah Rich. With a description of ambush followed by an elegy. Imperfect: stained, affecting ill. and title. Cf. Wing R1340 which has title "Death's envious triumph, in a memorial of ...". Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
Brief memorial of the losse of the late incomparable and excellent Andrew Lord Rutherford Earle of Teveot, &c. Killed by an ambuscadoe of Moores, May the 3d. 1664. Rich, Jeremiah, fl. 1664.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (metalcut).
Printed for Henry Marsh at the Princes Armes in Chancery-Lane, London, : 1664.
Signed at end: Jeremiah Rich. With a description of ambush followed by an elegy. Imperfect: stained, affecting ill. and title. Cf. Wing R1340 which has title "Death's envious triumph, in a memorial of ...". Reproduction of original in the British Library.
Henry Marsh
the Princes Armes in Chancery-Lane
